reviews.text: The hotel has been recently updated and has very nice rooms. Flat screen TV and very nice beds. The hotel also has a very nice workout facility and outdoor pool. If you are traveling here on business, it has everything that you need. It is next to the convention center as well as centrally located within walking distance to restaurants. Try Il Fornaio for a meal, it is right accross the street and the food is very good.
reviews.title: Very nice and convienient

reviews.text: I took a gamble last week and tried the Crowne Plaza because it was renovated and my agent thought I would enjoy it. Well, the room was great but the staff were horrible! I am so glad to have returned to Marriott where I know I will get a great room, great service and a good price.
reviews.title: Glad to return.....

reviews.text: I went to a conference at the San Jose Convention Center and stayed at the Marriott. I have no complaints. It was clean, mostly quiet (there was some construction nearby), everything was in good working condition. The room was large, and had nice views from the window. The bed was very comfortable, I got good nights of sleep every night. The hotel is adjacent to the Convention Center; you don't even have to go outside to go to your event. There are many restaurants nearby (I recommend heading north if you are looking for something to eat). There is also a light rail stop right in front of the hotel that will get you around San Jose/Santa Clara, and can give you a ride to the airport as well (although you still have to take a shuttle once you get to the airport station).
reviews.title: Very convenient to convention center

reviews.text: We were there for a conference, and therefore enjoyed good rates and a convenient location. The bed was very comfortable, and the linens were clean. The hotel staff courteous, friendly and helpful, but we had no special demands. The room was spacious but lacked enough drawer space for two adults for a week-long conference. The food at the in-house restaurant (Arcadia) was good and, to no one's surprise,
reviews.title: Adequate

likes.liked: — It was convenient to the conference I attended.

reviews.title: Noisy
reviews.text: outrageously expensive. The construction going on near the hotel was truly annoying and loud, but not the fault of the hotel. In short, the hotel was adequate, but certainly no 5-star.

This is an excellent hotel. Large, clean, good service, friendly staff. Excercise room is well-equipped. Did not try pool or hot tub, but they looked good. Cleaning staff is friendly. Rooms were clean, with nice large bathrooms.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Great hotel, great location
reviews.text: Hotel has restaurant, which I did not try due to many other options locally. The cafe in the lobby was good, though.
Hotel has two computers in the lobby with free internet access, though you may have to wait a while during peak times. There is also free WiFi in the lobby (though not in the rooms).
reviews.title: Pretty Good Hotel
Beyond expectations!
reviews.text: Someone [----]in the hallway on our floor, leading to a stinky hallway, but that's not the fault of the hotel.

Terrific experience at the San Jose Marriott. Short ride from the airport (less than $20 including tip), bellman greeted us immediately upon arrival with bottled water & to assist w/baggage. Arrived at 1pm PST (after having been traveling since 6am EST) and were allowed to check in early. Beautiful room, beautiful furnishings, COMFORTABLE bed! Bathroom was plenty big. Workstation area was comfortable and high speed internet access was very easy to use. Staff was very helpful at front desk, even maitre'd at hotel's signature restaurant assisted us with finding small cafe in town when looking for a light lunch (within walking distance). Public transport (light rail and buses) are easy to find right near hotel and can take you to the train station for points north. All in all a great hotel. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I'm a big Marriott fan as I always get great service, I love the beds, and while they tend to be a bit more expensive, it's always worth it. The San Jose Marriott is no exception.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel Attached to Conference Center

reviews.text: I've stayed here twice in the past year and haven't been disappointed. From the front desk, to room service, to the hotel bar, everything is done right and the people are super nice. A standard room with a King bed is quite big and I am a big fan of the bathrooms. I love a big bathroom to spread out all my stuff.
reviews.title: Treated like Cattle, Restaurant & Lounge Not Always Available to Guests

reviews.text: If you are attending a conference at the neighboring convention center, I definitely recommend staying here. The hotel is attached and you can walk right over. The only downside is if you have to park it's a bit expensive. I recommend parking at the garage across the street.
reviews.title: Never failed me

reviews.text: I chose this hotel due to its being adjacent to the conference center, at a total of $200+ for 1 night (incl. parking & tax). On arrival, I was told "The restaurant is closed because it's Sunday - you can eat in the room or in the lounge." After 3 hours in my car I didn't want to sit in a hotel room, but the lounge was standing room-only due to the hotel being full of conventioneers, and the restaurants across the street were packed for the same reason. The next day upon check-out, it took over an hour for valets to retrieve my car & since it was rush hour by then, I decided to kill time & get a bite in the crowded lounge - nope, it closed in my face at 5pm when all were kicked out for a private party. Couldn't even sit in the restaurant, which would not open 'til 5:30. Staff were trying, but getting burned out by all the irritated convention attendees (I assume all paying full price as I did). When you choose a hotel, pay a fair price and amenities advertised are unavailable (or sold to a private party), you are being ripped off. Marriott is compromising/sacrificing guest service to increase bottom line here (ex., how many quality hotels still charge for wireless?). (Apparently there is poor management at the policy-making level.)
reviews.title: Perfect Location if you need to be Downtown
Beware if sensitive to odors
reviews.text: I had to stay here for my house was being renovated. I have to say, the staff is very professional. I was able to fully utilize the fitness center and the restaurant. Rooms are very nice but a little noisy. Can't blame the hotel though this is not my residential neighborhood. Don't hesitate to book a room here. Overall i am happy that the renovation is completed and Marriott provided a comfortable stay. Thank you Marriott keep up the good job.

Stayed here several times, however, my last visit in August 2012 was not enjoyable. My stay at The Lodge at Sonoma Renaissance Resort & Spa was totally at the other end of the "Pleasure" scale, everyone made me feel welcomed. It's regrettable for hotel staff, especially the ones you initially meet when checking in, to ruin your trip before it even starts. Only Housekeeping had the initiative to brighten our days.
reviews.title: Not friendly to repeat customers

reviews.text: It is an OK hotel. I cannot think of anything that special about it, other than the central location. The parking is expensive, the food in the restaurant is pricey too. If you want to go online in your room, fees apply. The room is clean, bed is comfortable. If you are paying $200 plus and without expecting anything special, then you can stay there.
reviews.title: It is ok

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed for one night while she was participating in a dance competition across the street. Location was great. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, bathroom was spacious and clean. Check in and check out were efficient. There was no problem leaving our bags and car for the day after we checked out, which I appreciated.
reviews.title: convenient and comfortable

reviews.text: Some guests complained about slow elevators, but we did not have that issue.
reviews.title: Good hotel close to McEnery Convention Center

reviews.text: Several friends staying for the same event were offered, at check in, breakfast for 2 for an additional $10 added to their bill. We were not, and would have liked to opportunity to have added it. The coffee shop is under construction so they have an area of the lobby set aside for coffee, juices, muffins and sundries. We found the staff there to border on rude and the prices bordering on ridiculous.
reviews.title: Pretty nice ..although

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here recently during the PTA convention. The hotel is connected to the McEnery Convention Center so it is very convenient in that respect. I was disappointed at the lack of a reasonably priced dining option in the hotel. The only restaurant was Arcadia, which is a high-end steakhouse. We had the kids with us so we had to walk around town for our meals. The weather was great so ultimately it was not a huge issue. Our room was clean and bright. There a few issues, however, that impacted our stay. First, the bathroom towels were thin and felt like #2 sandpaper. Definite upgrade needed there. Second, the bathroom lacked a fan for venting out steam and other things. Third, the beds were very firm. On the opposite end of the spectrum, the hotel was booked solid but the fellow at the front desk was able to find us a room with two double beds. Also, the heated outdoor pool was larger than we expected considering this is basically a business hotel. Overall, I would consider the Marriott San Jose an average hotel, 3 stars. If they can upgrade the in-room amenities (towels, beds), then it could be a 4-star property.
reviews.title: Best Concierge Lounge out of any Marrriott I've Seen!

reviews.text: Got a very nice deal for the weekend. We actually arrived very early around 10 am, but were able to check in right away. Being a platinum member, we got upgraded to a nice suite on the 18th floor. Lot of windows makes the room look bigger. Room 1800 has beautiful views!
reviews.title: Good weekend rate

reviews.text: Positives: smooth check in, free upgrade (didn't ask), comfy bed, free bottled water, late check out, beautiful lobby, excellent location and yummy food in Arcadia.

reviews.text: Negatives: Lounge closed on weekends, no free breakfast for Platinum members, towels are so thin and harsh like sandpaper, in room safe was missing (but delivered later on). Asked for extra pillows upon check in, but never got them until asked again.

reviews.text: Lots of windows, but they get so hot, therefore room gets warm. Window in closet with stained curtains-tacky. Previous guest left some tissue stuck in peep hole in the door-tacky.... makes question housekeeping services.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, attached to Convention Center

reviews.text: Over all it was nice. Will stay again if price is good.
reviews.title: Fair to Just OK

reviews.text: I stayed here as part of a conference, and so had a really good room rate ($160). The elegance of the details of the room surprised me and was worthy of a 5 star hotel. The bathroom area was quite spatious, and the room was large. As with most of the higher-end Marriotts, the bed was very comfortable. I didn't hear any of my neighbors and I had a nice view of the conference center plaza. I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone attending the convention center.
reviews.title: Elegant and Soothing

reviews.text: As a side note, here is a tip: if you are staying in any of the hotels near the conference center, don't use the hotel parking, which is $26/day for most of them. Instead, use the conference center lot ($18 day) or one of the nearby public lots that are $15/day and entirely free on Sunday, including overnight.
reviews.title: Excellent Option

reviews.title: So fresh and so clean...

reviews.text: I grew up in the Bay Area and have stayed at most of the hotels in downtown San Jose. I would normally not have thought to stay at a Marriott but I knew that their property in San Jose was just a couple of years old. I booked a "deluxe king" via their website and the room was nice but didn't have any sitting area to speak of. They were able to upgrade me the second night to a room which had a loveseat and two chairs which made a big difference even though the room itself didn't seem appreciably bigger overall. Both bathrooms were spacious with marble counters and were spotlessly clean. I don't like shower curtains but the curved shower rod made it more tolerable. The water pressure wasn't great but I always wish the pressure would be greater. The bed was very comfortable and the, linens and pillows were very nice. Both rooms were corner rooms on high floors (19th and 23rd respectively) with beautiful views of Cesar Chavez plaza and the rest of downtown. Anyone who has been to San Jose knows that it "boasts" one of the LEAST impressive skylines but from that height even San Jose looked pretty. On to service... The valet parking guys were frazzled from the time we arrived until the time we left. They have a rather small and awkward "carriage way" in front of the hotel which quickly became clogged with arriving and departing guests and their vehicles. They also charge $25 / night for parking (which doesn't bother me but I know some people take exception to high valet parking fees so I thought I would mention it). The bellman was awesome... Outgoing, friendly and efficient. The front desk staff was likewise outgoing, friendly and efficient while I was checking in and checking out. Did not order room service but did dine at Arcadia (Michael Mina's restaurant on the lobby level) and while our server was overtaxed and unable to provide the attention we would have expected, the food was exceptionally good. Especially the lobster "corn dogs", whole fried chicken and macaroni and cheese. Obviously, this is a business class hotel and the rates and service reflect that. It is understandably MUCH busier during the week and since it is literally attached to the San Jose Convention center, it was inundated by conventioneers. That being said, my friends and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the San Jose Marriott.
reviews.title: Good Location
